scenes.background: You are on annual leave, enjoying some well-deserved time off to recharge. However, during your time away, a colleague messages you privately, saying thereâ€™s an urgent task that needs immediate attention. The request creates a dilemma as you try to balance respecting your time off while feeling the pressure to help with the urgent task. You chose to take a quick look and help out. After some time, [Monica] and [Bob] approach you in the cafeteria. [Monica] looks slightly concerned while [Bob] seems indifferent. [Monica] says, 'Hey [Alex], I heard you helped out with the urgent task during your leave. That's really commendable, but don't you think it's setting a precedent for others to bother you on your days off?' You responded assertively, stating that maybe the team needs to be more self-reliant. Now, [Monica] frowns slightly and [Bob] raises an eyebrow. [Bob] remarks, 'Well, if everyone just starts saying no to extra work, won't that leave us in a bind during real emergencies?' Monica crosses her arms and Bob looks at you expectantly as you take a moment to consider your response. You replied critically, suggesting the team rethink its dynamics. [Monica] and [Bob] both look taken aback, with Monica looking slightly upset.
scenes.description: [Monica] sighs and says, 'Alex, I understand where you're coming from, but don't you think there has to be a balance between personal time and team responsibilities?'

options.text: It's complicated, Monica. Maybe we need a more flexible approach.
options.analysis: You offer a diplomatic response, showing a balanced view but slightly lower social skills.

options.text: I see your point. Perhaps I need to find a better way to manage these situations.
options.analysis: You acknowledge the concern, showing good emotional perception and empathy but lower social skills and motivation.

options.text: If balancing personal time and work is so challenging, maybe we need to set stricter guidelines.
options.analysis: You suggest a stricter approach, showing strong motivation but lower empathy and social skills.
